TextSection.Contents: Extraventricular neurocytoma (EVN) a variant of central neurocytoma is a rare neuronal neoplasm composed of round cells with neuronal differentiation which is located outside of the ventricular system usually within the spinal cord or cerebral hemispheres and that manifests with headache nausea vomiting complex partial seizures or focal neurological deficits. In some cases it may exhibit atypical features consistent with aggressive clinical behavior.

Parent.Label: Pediatric gliomas, glioneuronal tumours, and neuronal tumours
